name: Osserman conjecture
rephrased: A Riemannian manifold is an Osserman manifold if the characteristic polynomial of its Jacobi operator, evaluated on unit tangent vectors, is constant across the entire unit tangent bundle.
implication_form: If a Riemannian manifold has a constant characteristic polynomial for its Jacobi operator on the unit tangent bundle, then it is an Osserman manifold.
explained: The Osserman conjecture, formulated by mathematician Robert Osserman, addresses Riemannian manifolds known as Osserman manifolds. An Osserman manifold is defined by the condition that the characteristic polynomial of the Jacobi operator, evaluated on unit tangent vectors, is constant across the entire unit tangent bundle. The conjecture itself posits that any Riemannian manifold satisfying this Osserman condition (i.e., being an Osserman manifold) must be conformally flat. In other words, the underlying metric can be transformed by a conformal change to a flat metric. This conjecture connects the algebraic properties related to curvature (encoded in the Jacobi operator) to the global geometric property of conformal flatness.
